Posts.Content: Apr 15, 2013 05:28PM Wildlyshel wrote: Here's my story right now. I am going through chemo and will finish May 31st. I will be meeting with my RO for a suggested course of treatment. I had 2 positive nodes but no evidence after surgery of anything in the nodes in my CT scan. I don't know if this means anything. I am concerned about the effect rads will have on me years from now. This is the beginning of my journey with rads research and treatment.

Wishing you the best through all your treatments. Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2013 08:14AM Wildlyshel wrote: Heidi - I was in a natural foods store with my mom who has trouble sleeping. She asked about melatonin for sleep and the woman who worked there cautioned her about using it more than four or five days. Her reasoning was that when using those types of hormones for a longer period your body thinks it doesn't have to produce its own and it basically you become more and more reliant on whatever you are taking. (simplistic explanation). I don't know how true this is but I wanted to tell you so you could look into it more if you chose to.

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2013 08:22AM Wildlyshel wrote: Gina - thanks for the info about the waiting period between chemo and rads. It explains why they wait until later in the chemo cycle before you meet with your RO. I have to admit though, I am gnashing at the bit to meet with the RO so I know what my summer will be like. I still don't know if I will do rads. They are saying I have to but I will have to be convinced. I haven't found anyone who has had a mastectomy and node involvement who hasn't done rads. I hate weighing the risks with the SEs.

Wishing you the best through all your treatments. Dx 12/12/2012, IDC, 1cm, Grade 3, 2/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 1/18/2013 Mastectomy: Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left; Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Chemotherapy 2/22/2013 AC + T (Taxol) Log in to post a reply
